intro: Pentacalia gonocaulos, commonly known as the showy pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in tropical and subtropical gardens.
